column4: I have an internal harddisk, and an external one. I want to install ubuntu onto the external one so that it's bootable when I take the internal one out. This means I have to install grub on the external one, right? Or will it still be dependent on the MBR on the internal disk?
you can. wont be dependent on internal one.
assuming your bios is new enough and allows you to boot off the external device.
i should know, that's what i'm doing right now :P.
